title: Create SummaryCalculator.ts
description:
New file: src/engine/match/SummaryCalculator.ts

Derives round summary ONLY from timeline events (never generates independently):

deriveFromTimeline(timeline: TimelineEvent[]): DerivedRoundSummary

Calculates:
- firstBlood: First KillEvent in timeline
- spikePlanted: Presence of PlantCompleteEvent
- spikeDefused: Presence of DefuseCompleteEvent
- spikeDetonated: Presence of SpikeDetonationEvent
- clutchAttempt: Detect 1vN situations from alive counts
- totalKills: Count all KillEvent
- totalDamage: Sum all DamageEvent.totalDamage
- roundDuration: Last event timestamp
- plantsAttempted: Count PlantStartEvent
- defusesAttempted: Count DefuseStartEvent

Principle: If event not in timeline, it MUST NOT appear in summary

title: Kill events should show damage dealt that resulted in the kill
description:
In the Round Timeline, when a kill event is displayed (e.g., koalanoob KILLED johnqt), it only shows the weapon used but not the damage dealt. Kills should result from accumulated damage from weapon/ability hits, and this damage should be displayed.

**Current behavior:**
- KillEventCard shows: killer name, victim name, weapon, headshot indicator
- No damage amount is shown

**Expected behavior:**
- Kill events should show the total damage dealt that resulted in the kill
- This requires correlating damage events with the kill event (same killer/victim)

**Root cause:**
- In RoundSimulator.ts generateAllRoundEvents(), kill events are generated independently from damage events
- KillEvent type (match.ts) lacks a damage field
- No tracking of which damage events contributed to each kill

**Files to modify:**
- src/types/match.ts - Add damage field to KillEvent
- src/engine/match/RoundSimulator.ts - Track damage when generating kills
- src/components/match/DamageTimeline.tsx - Display damage in KillEventCard
close_reason: Added damage field to KillEvent type and updated RoundSimulator to calculate damage from damage events. KillEventCard now displays the damage amount.
